Jesus fucking christ, i'm not saying that his drunk driving was good. I

comments.author: Alicia Fuentes

comments.text:
+Alicia Fuentes Yea he died in a fucking DRUNK DRIVING accident, in which 
he caused. Honestly the world has no place for grown ass adults who make 
stupid decisions. What if he had killed an innocent family? Just because 
he's famous doesn't mean shit stupid is indeed stupid. Also Steve-O and 
Charlie himself made dark humor jokes about people dying. I would view Amy 
as a bad person for joking about a WAR HERO or a CANCER PATIENT who had 
died, but a drunken dumb ass? Please.
comments.author: bluefgo

comments.text: Was Ryan Dunn a friend of yours?
comments.author: Bret .Maverick

comments.text:
Would you make a joke about someone's father who just died a month ago? 
Don't think you would. I just don't like her taste. The one joke doesn't 
define her for me, but it does for the media since it was a big thing. 
Seems like she kinda ruined it for herself. And no people don't refer me as 
a bitch for your information ;)!
comments.author: Alicia Fuentes

comments.text:
So how long does she have to wait before you making that joke?  If one 
month is not long enough, please explain so we all know the proper 
etiquette.

Comedians tell millions of jokes.  Even if you found one to be in poor 
taste, does that one joke define her?  She was really funny in this 
interview on this and all you can think of is a joke from a long time ago.  
To you she's a bitch for the rest of her life.  Way to judge people.

Just out of curiosity, do people often refer to you as a bitch?
comments.author: OA

comments.text:
I like watching roasts, but you can't make a fucking joke about someone who 
passed away nearly a month ago to his friend. It's distasteful. There's 
something like manners and class. And this bitch doesn't have it.

captions.text:
- I'VE SAID IT BEFORE
AND I'LL SAY IT AGAIN:
YOU'RE A VERY, VERY FUNNY WOMAN.

I SAW YOU
ON "LAST COMIC STANDING."

THAT'S THE LAST TIME
YOU WERE HERE.

HOW LONG AGO WAS THAT?
- SEVEN YEARS AGO.

- WOW!
- WE HAVEN'T AGED A DAY.

- NO, WE HAVE NOT.
- DON'T WE LOOK AMAZING?
[cheers and applause]
OH, STOP.
THAT'S NOT WHY WE DO THIS.
- YEAH.
- OH, MAYBE A COUPLE DAYS.

- MAYBE WE LOOK DIFFERENT.
- MAYBE TWO DAYS.

- TAKE THAT DOWN.
THAT'S GREAT.
- YEAH, THAT'S NOT COOL.

NOT COOL.
- NOT COOL AT ALL, AMY.

BUT I SAW YOU
ON "LAST COMIC STANDING,"

AND I WANTED TO HAVE YOU
ON THE SHOW,

'CAUSE I THOUGHT YOU WERE
VERY, VERY CLEVER, VERY FUNNY,
AND YOU'VE DONE VERY WELL.
CONGRATULATIONS.

- THANK YOU SO MUCH.
YEAH.
[cheers and applause]
THANK YOU.

YEAH, I WAS SO EXCITED
THAT YOU WANTED TO HAVE ME ON.

THAT WAS THE BIGGEST DEAL
IN THE WORLD TO ME.

AND I WAS TO GO
ON MY FIRST TOUR,
AND YOU WERE ENCOURAGING ME.
I FELT VERY ENCOURAGED BY YOU.
BUT I COULD TELL

YOU WERE KIND OF TRYING
TO WARN ME WITH YOUR EYES ALSO,

LIKE, "IT'S A JUNGLE OUT THERE.
THE ROAD'S GONNA BE HARD."

AND IT IS.
- IT'S HARD.
- YEAH, IT'S ROUGH.

- YEAH, YOU'RE ALWAYS ON A PLANE
OR IN A HOTEL ROOM
AND A STRANGE CITY ALL THE TIME.

SO NOW YOU GET TO LIVE
IN NEW YORK AND DO YOUR SHOW.
- YEAH.

- AND YOU'RE STARTING--
IS IT THE SECOND SEASON?

- YES, THE SECOND SEASON
STARTS TOMORROW.

- IT'S VERY FUNNY.
- THANK YOU.

- REALLY, REALLY FUNNY.
- THANK YOU SO MUCH.

YEAH, AND I'M REALLY PROUD THAT
WE GET TO SHOOT IT IN NEW YORK.

AND--BUT I GREW UP JUST LOVING
FEMALE COMICS,

AND MY FAVORITE SHOWS WERE--
I LOVED WATCHING GILDA ON "SNL"

AND LUCILLE BALL
AND CAROL BURNETT AND YOU.

AND SO TO HAVE MY OWN SHOW IS,
LIKE, A REALLY, REALLY BIG DEAL.

- AND IT'S A VERY SUCCESSFUL
SHOW ON COMEDY CENTRAL AS WELL,
SO CONGRATULATIONS ON THAT.
- THANK YOU.

- YEAH, YOU'RE GETTING
GOOD REVIEWS, GOOD RATINGS,
ALL THAT IMPORTANT STUFF.

NOW YOU'RE GOING TO--YOU WENT
TO THE "VANITY FAIR" PARTY,

SO YOU'RE IN
WITH THE IN CROWD HERE.

- I AM VERY RICH AND FAMOUS,
AS YOU GUYS CAN--OBVI, RIGHT?

NO, I THOUGHT IT WAS A MISTAKE
THAT I WAS INVITED.

EVEN THOUGH MY PUBLICIST
WHO DOES PUBLICITY FOR THE SHOW
WAS, LIKE, REALLY CONFUSED

WHY THEY WERE GONNA ALLOW ME
TO BE THERE.

LIKE, SHE'S LIKE,
"DO YOU KNOW SOMEONE

THAT WORKS
AT THAT RESTAURANT?"
LIKE, "WHY ARE YOU INVITED?"
AND I WAS SO EXCITED.

I BROUGHT MY SISTER,
AND I SAW YOU THERE,
AND YOU GUYS LOOKED AMAZING,

AND I THOUGHT THE NICEST THING
I COULD DO
WOULD BE TO NOT TALK TO YOU.
THAT WAS MY GIFT TO YOU.
OH, THERE'S ME AND MY SISTER.
MY ROAD MANAGER ALSO.

- I'M SORRY I DIDN'T SEE YOU.
I WOULD'VE SAID HELLO.

BUT IT'S CRAZY--IT WAS CRAZY.
A LOT OF PEOPLE THERE.

- EVERYONE IS SO FAMOUS.
I THOUGHT IT WAS A MISTAKE.
I THOUGHT WE WOULD GET THERE,

AND SOMEBODY WOULD HAND ME
A TRAY AND BE LIKE,

"YOU'RE GONNA STAND HERE
AND GIVE OUT SHRIMP SHUMAI."

AND I WAS LIKE, "GREAT.
PEOPLE LOVE THAT."

BUT WE GOT ALL DOLLED UP,
AND WE FELT REALLY BEAUTIFUL.

WE WERE LIKE, "WAIT"--
BECAUSE I THINK EVERY WOMAN--

YOU'RE, LIKE,
KIND OF SUSPICIOUS.
LIKE, "AM I MAYBE GORGEOUS?"
LIKE, MAYBE--MAYBE I'M A MODEL

AND I HAVEN'T JUST, LIKE,
STUMBLED ON THE RIGHT LOOK YET.
YOU KNOW?

AND I GOT THERE,
AND I FELT REALLY GOOD,

AND THEN I WALKED IN
AND WAS JUST HIT BY A WALL

OF ALL THE "SPORTS ILLUSTRATED"
SWIMSUIT MODELS,

AND I WAS LIKE, "OH, OKAY,"
AND I UNDERSTOOD.
I'M NOT REALLY A WOMAN.

I'M JUST--I'M HARVESTING ORGANS
FOR A REAL WOMAN...
[laughter]

IN CASE--LIKE, IF KATE UPTON
ONE DAY NEEDS A LIVER,

I'LL BE LIKE,
"HERE, THIS IS YOURS."
LIKE, "PLEASE," RIGHT?
[laughter]

I REALIZED THAT NIGHT,
BECAUSE I FEEL GOOD.

I KNOW HOW TO DRESS
WHERE IT LOOKS GOOD ON ME.

LIKE, I HIGHLIGHT THIS AREA
A LOT.

LIKE, RIGHT ABOVE THE KNEE
OR HERE.

LIKE, THIS 3/4 LENGTH SLEEVE,
THIS IS NOT AN ACCIDENT.
THIS IS, LIKE, LOOK.

IT'S LIKE, "HOW IS THERE NO RING
ON THIS FINGER?
THIS GIRL IS"...
LOOK AT THIS SECTION.

BUT THEN, LIKE, HERE,
IT KIND OF HITS THE FAN.

UNDER HERE, IT'S KIND OF LIKE
A LAVA LAMP.

LIKE, THINGS ARE--
THINGS ARE MOVING

AND NOTHING REALLY SETTLES,
YOU KNOW?

IT'S VERY CONFUSING
IN THIS SECTION.

- WOW, YOU'RE GETTING
A LOT OF PEOPLE

THAT'LL BE CALLING YOU NOW,
BECAUSE THAT'S...
- RINGING OFF THE HOOK.

- AND THERE'S A PICTURE
THAT I SAW

THAT I DON'T REALLY
FULLY UNDERSTAND.

CAN YOU EXPLAIN THIS?
- OH, WAIT.

DON'T PUT IT UP YET,
IF YOU DIDN'T PUT IT UP YET.

OKAY, UM, SO MY SISTER--
I BROUGHT HER WITH ME,

AND--AND I SAW THE HEMSWORTH
BROTHERS STANDING TOGETHER.
GOD'S GIFT TO THE WORLD.

THE MOST BEAUTIFUL MEN
AND MAYBE WOMEN WALKING AROUND.

AND I JUST SAID--I WAS LIKE,
"OH, MY GOSH,"

AND WE'D ALREADY
TAKEN OUR HEELS OFF,

'CAUSE WE WERE OUT
OF THE RUNNING.

NOBODY'S LOOKING AT US
LIKE WOMEN.

SO I'M LIKE,
"GET A PICTURE OF US."

AND MY SISTER--
WE'RE SO CLOSE.

I'VE NEVER ASKED HER
FOR ANYTHING.
I'VE GIVEN HER THE WORLD.

SO WE JUST GET THIS PICTURE
OF ME WITH THESE GORGEOUS BOYS.
SO I STAND IN THE MIDDLE,

AND THIS IS THE PICTURE
THAT MY SISTER TAKES OF ME.
[laughter]

THAT'S HER.
THERE'S MY SISTER.
I'VE GIVEN YOU SO MUCH, KIM.
I'VE DONE EVERYTHING FOR YOU.
- THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING.

- SHE--JUST WHAT--
WHAT A FAILURE.

- YEAH.
- WHAT A FAILURE.
- DID YOU FEEL THE EARTHQUAKE?

- YES.
THIS WAS MY FIRST EARTHQUAKE.
I--YEAH, THANK YOU.
IT WAS SO SCARY.

YEAH, THAT'S, LIKE,
THE ONE THING

WE HAVE OVER L.A.
IN NEW YORK.

WE'RE LIKE, "WELL, AT LEAST
WE DON'T HAVE EARTHQUAKES."
BUT I WAS--I WOKE UP TO IT,

AND IT'D BEEN, LIKE, STARTING
TO SEE THIS NEW GUY,

AND YOU REALLY LEARN A LOT
ABOUT SOMEBODY

DURING AN EARTHQUAKE,
BECAUSE, YOU KNOW,

YOU WOULD THINK HE WOULD BE
LIKE, "OH, ARE YOU OKAY?"

BUT HE ACTUALLY TRIED TO USE ME
AS A HUMAN SHIELD

IN CASE, LIKE, A BEAM FELL
ON HIM OR SOMETHING.

SO I'M SINGLE.
WHAT'S UP?
[cheers and applause]

CHIVALRY IS DEAD.
- YEAH.
WELL, IT'S NOT REALLY,

BUT THAT'S NOT THE RIGHT GUY
FOR YOU.

OH, I HAVE A GIFT FOR YOU
BEFORE YOU GO.
I JUST REALIZED.

BECAUSE I FELT BAD ABOUT THAT
PICTURE THAT YOUR SISTER TOOK,
SO I GOT YOU SOMETHING, AND...
- [laughs]
[cheers and applause]
LOOK AT THESE FACES.
I CAN'T--THANK YOU.

WHAT IS MY HAND DOING?
LIKE, WHAT'S HAPPENING?

OKAY.
- CARESSING HIS CHEST.

- I CAN'T THANK YOU ENOUGH.
- YOU'RE WELCOME.

- THIS IS THE BEST GIFT EVER.
THANK YOU.
- LET ME KNOW WHERE YOU HANG IT.

title: Amy Schumer's Photo with The Hemsworths
